item.title: Script to add a page-level variable to content front matter in hugo
item.description: This was originally a question posed on the hugo discussion forums. The user wanted to loop through all her content files and add a weight page-level variable to the front matter. The value of weight needed to be the first 2 characters of the content filename, since her content was named like 01_content.md, 02_content.md, etc. She then wanted to range through her pages by their weight, like so: {{ range .

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.
